website_summaries.verdict: The Sony BDP-S590 is a great-looking Blu-ray player with built-in Wi-Fi, 3D compatibility, and tons of streaming-media apps, but it's slow to load discs and has some user interface quirks.
pros: The Sony BDP-S590 has built-in Wi-Fi, 3D compatibility, and an ample suite of streaming-media services, including Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant, Pandora, and Vudu
It's also the sleekest Blu-ray player I've seen this year, with a well-designed remote that includes a dedicated Netflix button
The BDP-S590 is also one of the better players for playing back digital media files like MKV, DivX, and Xvid
cons: Sony's user interface isn't as intuitive as those from some competitors, especially the interfaces for Amazon Instant and Hulu Plus
It's also relatively slow at loading discs, taking almost twice as long as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product; will not buy Sony Blu Ray player ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product; will not buy Sony Blu Ray player again. My player gets moderate use; maybe 3-4 movies per week. I started getting a pink "flash" when the movies were playing after about six months. Tried cleaning to no avail. The worst problem was the WiFi connectivity. Things worked fine for a year or so with amazon prime, you tube, etc; and now all of a sudden it won't connect to the home network. Every other 7-8 peripherals including another Blu ray player works great; but not this piece of ****. I've spent countless hours reading posts, etc to fix it and now I'm done. Will go with Panasonic or Samsung in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Sony does not support its products ... buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these about 4.5 years ago. One of them began breaking down after about two years. First the wireless card broke and refused to connect to my router. Now it gives perpetual network errors (even though I've been using it with an ethernet cable directly connected to my router since the wireless card broke). The other one works mechanically, but because Sony does not support their products (why should they when they can force you to spend money on the newest model?) the YouTube and web browser apps no longer work, and the Netflix app has lost functionality since Netflix updated its api and Sony won't fix it's app. I'd recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: RE-SET over and over and over again
customer_reviews.text: Sony set out to make this product as complicated as possible. They succeeded at that. To connect via WIFI...you must type in a long, long WEP key number and the remote U must use will make you type double letters so it will take about 20 minutes. USB drive works today...not tommorrow so you have to reset by unplugging waiting 10 minutes and then you get to type in the WEP key all over again because sony did not see fit to build a product that could put this in memory...unplug it and all your settings WEP key are gone. DO NO BUY THIS CHEAP CHINESE PLAYER.
customer_reviews.author: phillip

customer_reviews.title: Player works YouTube app sorry
customer_reviews.text: This works great but in 2015 the YouTube app would no longer work on my Samsung smart TV. Bummer because the app use to work just like my computer giving me lots of program options and no limits. Now, I have to use this crappy "New YouTube for TV" app that is not worth didly. The disk player work great, no problems. It's just the app. I won't speculate if it's a matter of someone feeling the customers are getting a good deal but that new replacement app that showed up with a "software update" sucks. Come on Sony, man-up and give us a great YouTube app like we use to have!
customer_reviews.author: Nick in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: YouTube video has quit working, audio only
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2012, and last year of course the YouTube app included quit working, but with an update to the player a new YouTube app was in the lineup and it worked great. However as of yesterday (3 4 2016) the new app will no longer show YouTube video, only audio. The thumbnails are there to see which video you are accessing, but when you go to play it only the audio works. I have unplugged the unit and this does not fix it. Is this the players fault, or something on YouTubes end? I am afraid to buy the latest Sony player, as they have been getting very bad reviews here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's terrific but don't count on it to keep working.
customer_reviews.text: Blu-ray player worked fine from date of purchase until Feb, 2016 when it suddenly decided that none of the internet apps would work. I could connect to the internet but any of the video specific apps like Netflix and Amazon Prime would not work. Pages of fixes on the internet, clearly Sony knows this is a problem but their list of fixes don't work on my machine. So, I'm stuck with this worthless piece of crap and won't buy another Sony product due to all the people who clearly are having problems with all their Blu-ray players, same problem - no fixes. Shame on you, Sony.
customer_reviews.author: C. Close

customer_reviews.title: It's a blu-ray player, and that's what I'm rating it as
customer_reviews.text: After many years of saying "Blu-ray won't catch on.. just wait" I finally had to realize that I was wrong. And seeing as the price isn't frightening I thought why not. Researching a blu-ray player is kind of difficult since no one seem to actually review it's main purpose; playing blu-ray discs. I couldn't care less if it's as smart as Einstein, as elegant as Victoria Beckham, and as fast as Usain Bolt. Does it play my Blu-Rays? Yes it does!! Does it play my DVD's? Yes!! Plays all-region DVD's, at least the ones I've tried (1 & 2), and as far as I know only region 1 and region free Blu-Ray's.
customer_reviews.author: Eskil

customer_reviews.title: Slow poor interface
customer_reviews.text: Wait 25 seconds...choose netflix or amazon....wait 20 seconds ..."Internet connection ready" ....you must click ok. Remote control randomly clicks buttons on the other side of the remote. Randomly dims the picture or flickers even at static menus. The onscreen keyboard takes notes from the worst interfaces ever and often the keys you choose aren't what the box selects. Everything is slow for no reason. Even if your not doing anything with a disc or the Internet. No way to log out of your account without unregistering the device. Cant register 2 accounts. One of the worst purchases I've made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Youtube app is broken on the player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2012. As of March 2016, google changed something and the Sony youtube app no longer works. Neither Sony or Google has fixed this. They problem is discussed here: [...] I feel the lack of Sony support in resolving this problem is disgraceful. Otherwise it is fine as a Blu-Ray and DVD player and the amazon instant video app works fine.
customer_reviews.author: HYTRIN5

customer_reviews.title: It has the same problem that other Sony's have
customer_reviews.text: So I specifically purchased this blu-ray because it was Amazon on-demand ready and wireless. It has the same issue as another Sony blu-ray which is that the wireless stops working just all of a sudden. If you look up solutions on the internet, it looks like it's a fairly common issue where your wireless will work fine on your laptop, your cell, your tablet or any other device but will not connect at all on your DVD player and this is even when I shut off all those other devices to give it the strongest wireless signal possible. I wouldn't purchase another Sony blu-ray if having internet connectivity is important to you.
customer_reviews.author: DatDCFrancochick

customer_reviews.title: Wi Fi and Blu-ray!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the following reasons: 1. Easy to operate. 2. Adequate instructions. 3. Works with Logitech Harmony universal remote. 4. Wi-Fi can be configured easily. 5. Way more apps than comparable players. 6. Also plays audio CDs. Few more details: My first blu-ray player and its awesome. Setting up internet wifi was easy. Netflix plays really well from this player. Earlier I was playing Netflix from either the Wii console or the laptop. From the Wii console it was really difficult to get subtitles for the movies. Connecting the laptop was an additional setup. This made it convenient and comes with a great Netflix app that provides subtitles for everything. So overall, great product from Sony.
customer_reviews.author: AAA

customer_reviews.title: Died after only 6 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: This bluray player is not much different than any other player I've experienced except this one never worked right. First, on multiple occasions the player froze and needed to be unplugged to reboot. Second, after less than 6 months it will no longer turn on. The features were nice while it lasted i.e. Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, YouTube etc.. and when it played bluray or DVD discs the quality was fine (however we found it difficult to see any difference in picture/sound quality between bluray and DVD on our 1080p HDTV). Sony definitely ain't what they used to be as this isn't the first horrible experience I've had with Sony electronics in the last couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Good Player, Wayyyy Overpriced at 279.99
customer_reviews.text: This is a good player. No real complaints, but I purchased this for 1/3 the price in February of this year. Why would anyone pay 3x the price for a discontinued model? Updated Review. It's just over a year and it won't connect to Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc. The internet is connected. I've been through all the steps and on rare occasion repeatedly unplugging it will get it to work for a short period of time. Very disappointed with this Sony Blu-ray player. I won't buy another one. Oh, and the price listed right now is 329.99!!!! I guess the price goes up the more out-of-date the product is?
customer_reviews.author: kmr

customer_reviews.title: Locks up
customer_reviews.text: I read this in another review and I'm facing the same experience - It doesn't lock up regularly for me as stated on that review but it does sometimes which is really disappointing. Features wise I really don't have much of an opinion as I really wouldn't use anything but my Xbox for anything this box claims to do, except for playing Blu-ray disks :). Which I will get it fixed with the Xbox One console as soon as it hits the streets! For playing blu-rays only, really nothing special - I would've given 3 or 2 stars anyway. Since it locks up, meaning it not really very reliable, I will give it 2 stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: M4RC3L0

customer_reviews.title: Last of the great compromises.
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell this is the latest model that still outputs hdmi simultaneously with composite video. I used that to pipe a signal to the kitchen tv so it carries the same program as the family room. I set hdmi to 1080i to achieve this (suggested by another reviewer). I used the wired Ethernet connection but it also has wifi, which I did not try. I bought this because my old sony could not play .mp4 videos and this one does. I just leave the usb powered disk connected to the back usb port.
customer_reviews.author: beanhead

customer_reviews.title: Why is it impossible to find a good Blu-ray player?
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with a Toshiba (it constantly powered itself on and off) so I bought this Sony which had the best reviews at the time. It worked pretty well for a while. Now 8 months later, brand new DVDs and Blu-rays stop playing and the machine goes through gyrations that make it sound like a washing machine. Pathetic. It seems part of the problem is that all of these Blu-ray machines are software driven and anyone with a PC knows how many bugs there are with software...I miss my simple DVD player which didn't always try to "think" and therefore stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Nice loading time, plays in 3D
customer_reviews.text: Bought this player for it's claims of fast loading times and it's ability to play 3D on our 3d TV. The loading times are certainly shorter than the Blueray player this one replaced and the 3D worked as well. I don't care much for the 3D feature, but the kids like it. I appreciate the much faster loading. The player also has "smart tv" features that we will not use (our tv is already smart). But these features may be attractive as well to those who don't already have them. I can't say this is the fastest loading Blueray player, only that it loads much faster than the one we were using before. The price is okay too.
customer_reviews.author: customer 187

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2012 and still use it today. Very forgiving on fingerprint and scratch covered discs. Good streaming options and links to my server. Very happy with it. It does take a bit long to load a disk, but that is definitely minor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Ciesiel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Blu Ray
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Samsung Blu Ray player (that only had Netflix, Youtube and Pandora). First off let me give a disclaimer, I purchased this around Black Friday, so the price was decent. Then Amazon issued me a $5 dollar gift card to use for videos. Then Sony sent me an email for 3 months free Hulu Plus ($24 value) So those 2 things helped influence me a little bit. Once you run thru the setup of the device, its very easy to connect to your wireless network. And comparing the Sony to the Samsung, there are a ton of apps built in, Pandora, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, just to name a few.
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Best Bku-ray and media player I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This won't be a very technical review but I have to say this is the best blu-ray player I have ever owned. It's super fast loading BR discs and the image quality is superb. I also use this as a media player and have a 1.5TB HD connected to it and it has played numerous files of varying formats without hesitation, without lag and perfectly (older video file formats as well as newer compression methods). Netflix streams perfectly (but I connected a network cable) as do the other streaming servies. Sony has always been hit or miss with me concerning the quality of their electronics but this player is top notch in my opinion and was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R. Call

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Vizio Blu-ray that was adequate but slow to connect to the network, slow to load DVDs and very slow to load Netflix. Frequent buffering on Netflix too. Trying to fast forward a few frames in Netflix was also very slow to begin showing the movie again. I have not experienced any of this slowness with this player. I'm particularly pleased with Netflix performance. Video/audio quality is excellent on my Plasma HDTV. Setup was very easy and doesn't require reading the manual first.
customer_reviews.author: Debi K. Bulin

customer_reviews.title: Great Features and Value
customer_reviews.text: This blu-ray player sits at the opposite end of the house from my router, on another floor. I had some initial problems connecting it to my wifi (not a fault of the BDP-S590 but a setting on my router), but once I got it connected, everything streamed beautifully. Netflix, Slacker Radio, Amazon Video, YouTube - all work perfectly. The blu-ray video looks fantastic via HDMI. I do not use the 3D feature, but it's there when I decide to upgrade my TV. I really like the Media Remote feature which turns my android phone into a remote. I can also send pics and vids from my phone wirelessly which is a nice trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Android app available
customer_reviews.text: Everything works, streams from my server, windows 8 and 7 machines. While it is not mentioned, there is a Sony Android remote app that works well on my S3 to control it. I did have to contact Sony to remember a long forgotten password to enable the net enhanced functions to get on Amazon Prime, Vudu etc, but once connected the picture quality is well above my older LG. Yes the user interface is clunky but how do you make a interface for a remote control not clunk? The app makes it much easier as it lets you use a phone keyboard to input.
customer_reviews.author: A.Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Works great - loads faster than others ive had
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-ray player has worked great for me. Compared to other players i've tried and owned, it loads disks fairly quick. Having owned a ps3, the menu came natural as it is the same. But it is also simple and easy enough to use that anyone can navigate it. My favorite feature is having Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, etc built in. I also love having the Netflix button on the remote, so you dont have to navigate to it. netflix and other apps load quickly, and I have not had any trouble with it buffering with the wireless as I have with other products.
customer_reviews.author: C.Will

customer_reviews.title: It works well although the startup is a bit slow
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good quality machine and the picture looks great to me. The Internet browsing isn't that good because you are using a TV remote and it gets tedious entering things and waiting so I don't use that function. The wifi setup was easy if you use that option. I've always purchased Sony DVD players and they last forever, I'm sure this unit will do the same. Decent price and does the job. I found the startup a little slow when you insert a disc but this is my first blue ray player so I have nothing to compare it to. Purchase your HDMI cable on amazon because store mark them WAY UP!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I had this blu ray player and it was used in my bedroom. I used this player, maybe twice, in 2 years. The 3rd time I went to watch it, it powered in just fine and after the movie was over, I shut it off and went to sleep. The next morning, I powered it on to get the movie (red box) and it wouldn't turn on or open at all. I had to take it completely apart to get my movie out. I tinkered and it never fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Easily installed Sony Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: A comprehensive comparison review of Amazon products that would be compatible with a 46" flat screen TV resulted in the choice of a mid-range Sony Blu-Ray DVD Player. The Player has remarkable performance characteristics and is easily connected, both to the flat screen television and our wirelessly routed home network system. It's worth mentioning the advance in Player function results in a minimum of wired connections! The only extraneous cable is HDMI from Player to Television set. The Sony Blu-Ray DVD Player is well-priced and performs with excellent visual quality!
customer_reviews.author: 1arapaho

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BLUERAY PLAYER!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I JUST PURCHASED THIS PLAYER THIS WEEK. I AM IMPRESS WITH THE EASY SETUP. GET A HDMI FOR A EASY SETUP. IT CONNECTED RIGHT AWAY WITH MY INTERNET CONNECTION VIA WIFI. IT HAS SO MANY APPLICATION TO PLAY WITH. I FEEL LIKE A KID IN A CANDY STORE. I LOVE MY BLUERAY PLAYER. SONY PRODUCTS ARE TOP OF THE LINE. I HAVE A SONY SOUNDBAR (HT-CT60). PERFECT COMBINATION. I FEEL LIKE IM IN A MOVIE THEATRE. YOU CANT GO WRONG WITH THIS BLUE RAY PLAYER. PROS: LOTS OF APPS EASY SETUP WITH A HDMI CABLE USB PORT FOR EXTERNAL HARDDRIVE 3D COMPATIBLE CONS: NONE I CAN THINK OFF
customer_reviews.author: convill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, is mostly simple to operate, and the remote is well laid out and intuitive. I got it after returning the Panasonic DMP-BDT220 which was so highly hyped by cnet and other sites because it was totally non-intuitive and the manual was incomprehensible. I consider this machine highly superior, more intuitive, has more options built in, and is not at all slow to start up (as was stated in some reviews.) It also plays SACD audio disks although I have not tried that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: I was forced to buy this.
customer_reviews.text: A friend who knew I was interested in World War 2 gave me a set of 6 disks about the war in the Pacific. I couldn't wait to watch them. Then I looked at the cover and saw the dreaded BurRay. No BluRay reader. Buy or borrow? I checked Amazon and found that they had several models and they were incredinly inexpensive. After getting the player and the installation was easy, I found the icture quality incredibly amazing. It was worth the money and time because WW2 on a 52" TV at 1080 resolution is like being there. The kamikazis look like they are headed directly at you. It's well worth the money and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: FarmAnimal

customer_reviews.title: Worthless after only 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Like others in the one star category - after functioning well for less than 18 months - this thing's best purpose is now a door stop. Slow to load but nice quality while it worked. 18 months is not an acceptable product life IMHO. Now audio and video drop out nearly continuously and we have to go buy another. After reading others dead-ends in trying to get a fix I'll cut my losses and buy something else. Why can't companies make products that hold up? Guess we keep buying them. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am hoping I'm not jumping the gun on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I think this player is a very good one with awesome features.I did have problems with the synchronization to my tv at first but a call to sony seems to have fixed that problem.The 3D images where ghosting sometimes.They had me change a setting and it seems to be ok now.The only other complaint I have is that the auto resume seems to work only part of the time.I will probably have to get back on the phone with Sony on that too cause that is annoying as hell.When you stop a DVD it is supposed to remember where you left off but it doesn't all the time.
customer_reviews.author: thomas e haggerty

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: purchased this because xbox got stupid and made it impossible to use netflix without paying their annual subsription price on top of your monthly netflix subscription. went on amazon (my go-to for anything random) and dound this, which allowed me to not only get my netflix back, but also music channels, and all wirelessly with the built in wifi. I was very happy, and although I did not have any blu-rays prior to this, i have already started adding to my collection. set-up was easy, and have had no problems with it since it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: bgr1344

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Blu-Ray Player!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up. The Internet joined our wireless network immediately after entering the password. No problem! I love being able to use it for Netflix and Amazon instead of the Roku. It works so much better for watching movies and I have had none of the problems with subtitles on foreign films like the Roku. The DVD/Blu-Ray works great and is a lot faster than our recently departed blu-ray player. The picture is perfect. Summary: We really love this player. It works like it is supposed to work. I hope that is lasts for a reasonable time.
customer_reviews.author: Jakpro

customer_reviews.title: More than expected!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blu-ray player! It has all of the bells and whistles! Nice sleek design, and easy setup. I have no problem connecting my player to wifi. Connects with Amazon Instant Video, Netflixs, and Hulu. Way more than I expected. Way to many pros to list, read the detailed description. If I was to nitpick, here are my cons: You have to point the remote directly to the player. It does not work that well if you are at an angle. Does not come with an HDMI cable. Given the cons, I still rated this a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Wifi needs work
customer_reviews.text: I had to return my first one i received would not turn on unless the hdmi was unplugged for some reason but got the second one and has worked flawlessly since day one. I have used the amazon steaming feature a couple of times but its kinda clumsy to navigate around and it sucks to set up the registration with the remote. The wifi is pretty slow and had problems with the movie hanging up. (blu ray player slow not the wireless at the house) But for watching movies its awsome and pretty reasonably priced. Would recommend if you do not plan on streaming allot of movies over wifi.
customer_reviews.author: woodzy

customer_reviews.title: Fragile HDMI output!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone thru 2 of this BD players back to back over the same issue: the HDMI visual output cut out after minor storms- twice!. All My peripherals are shielded behind a sound surge protector with a circuit breaker. It's worth noting that the audio still worked fine. No esuppport troubleshooting directions have solved the issue. Contacting Sony is a nightmare, too. Needless to say, My Sony fan days are over!!
customer_reviews.author: Mza$h

customer_reviews.title: works better than dedicated streaming players
customer_reviews.text: i purchased a roku player that worked well for about a week and then had to reset every time. got fed up of intermittent streaming and frequent tech calls, so returned it. i wasn't sure about the BD player since it is not a dedicated streaming device like the roku but i was pleasantly surprised how well it worked. it does act up occasionally but never had to reset it and streams much better and consistent. the BD player part was an added bonus as well plus it up-converts DVD's to HD quality. set up is easy and navigation is not bad either. very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus Mathews

customer_reviews.title: good picture after changing the cable
customer_reviews.text: I got this blu-ray player about a month ago. At first, I used the cables that came with it to hook it to my TV - the picture was so-so. However, when I switched over to a HDMI cable, the picture quality improved greatly. I like the fact that I can stream movies and music using my Wifi network - Netflix, Amazon, VuDu (can now watch those Ultraviolet movies I never knew what to do with!), Pandora all come through beautifully in both picture and sound quality. Blu-ray and DVD disks both play fine, but I will note that they load rather slowly - not horrible, but slower than I am used to.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: interesting device, I'm glad I ordered and bought it
customer_reviews.text: The first thing it did when I connected it and plugged in - it updated its firmware. It was kind of surprise, because the device should ask for a permission to do that. The good news - it didn't break anything and it's still able to work and do what I really expect it to do. Any disks including DVD, Audio, BD, etc. Very good quality of a video from BD disks, much better than from the previous device. Such a pleasant surprise to have free internet content, the ability to load and drive a number of channels audio and video, both commercial and free.
customer_reviews.author: DSh

customer_reviews.title: We are not happy with this bluray player
customer_reviews.text: This bluray player is really touchy. The picture will snow/pixilate multiple times throughout a movie. It is very frustrating to have to pause a movie to wait for the snow/pixilation to pass before we can continue on with the movie. We have tried different HDMI cables; however, it does not seem to help. We even updated the firmware on the player. We will dump this player as soon as we can afford to replace it. Very disappointed. We will not be buying Sony products again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: Sony Blu ray player plugs into the home theatre system and HDTV just fine. I put DVD or Blu ray disks directly into the player and it works fine, just a little slow. It does have WIFI capability but since my Sony HDTV has WIFI I haven't figured it out yet on the BLU RAY player. I've read reviews about this one and supposedly it's not the best, but I'm not having any issues with it. The price point was reasonable and it fits in my wall unit just fine. One hdmi cable plugs into the back and then either into the TV or in my case into the home theatre system.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily20190

customer_reviews.title: Love Love!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my workout room/ home office. I can connect to my streaming workout videos using my wifi. I also use it to connect to streaming TV shows. It was really easy to get connected to the internet. I can also stream music, add photos for a slide show and other items. It's like having a smart tv but a fraction of the price! The only con is in order to add a url I have to type every letter using the remote vs a keyboard. Still trying to figure out if I can connect a wireless keyboard. At any rate, I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony S590 DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Bought it for streaming capability as trying to avoid $70 additional cable charges on top of $40 month Internet fees. Easy hookup, it automatically found my IP address and connected to WIFI Few little login/security settings. I stream video from Amazon, Netflix. Has most sites compatibility you have ever heard of.Remote is standard, easy to figure out. Great with Blu ray. Overall great DVD player, but shop around for price, came with HDMI cable, some advertise cheaper but no cable included
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Prime Account Rocks with this BD Player!
customer_reviews.text: I've read a few of the 1 star comments, and frankly, I have not experienced anything negative with this BD player. Set up was easy and it found my wireless network effortlessly. I love all of the "specific" buttons on the remote, such as the one labeled, "NetFlix." Watching Amazon streaming movies in HD with my Prime account is a real joy. The only negative I have - and it has nothing to do with the Sony BD player so it doesn't affect my rating - is that the Amazon streaming movies and television shows are not captioned. Netflix wins in this category.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Hale

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player as a replacement for my standard DVD player. It does a great job playing DVDs and Blu-ray disks, but it also has a ton of online features, including Netflix and Amazon Prime (plus many other online offerings) built-in and ready to go. Connecting to my home wifi network was a snap. The wifi connection is solid (I use an Apple Airport - best wireless router made), and the delivery of programming is uninterrupted. I have this player connected through my Yamaha sound system via HDMI, so the sound and picture are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray Player with lots of options
customer_reviews.text: I bought this DVD player for my parents as a gift. Great Blu-ray player and easy to use. It connects to the Wi-Fi, so you can access NetFlix, YouTube, Amazon Prime, etc. My husband found an app on the Ipad that you can use to as the remote. It's easier to use than the remote that came with the player. It gets a little tricky doing searches on Amazon Streaming, because the letters are so small on the screen, if you are trying to conduct a search for a movie or show. However, the app on the IPad, lets you type your search request. Other than that, this is a great player and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony makes it hard to do warranty repair
customer_reviews.text: player lasted 2 1/2 months. Will not play any dvd's just spent 3 hours with sony support and do not have resolution. I do not write reviews, but do not want anyone else to have the same problems that i had. I cannot get anyone from sony to tell me where to send the player to repair it, since it is under warranty. I am very disappointed with Sony. DO NOT BUY, especially for the lack of support if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: tall cool thing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and smooth connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 6 month new Vizio Blu-Ray player that would never maintain a WiFi connection with my home network. The moment I installed the Sony it was and is off and running perfectly! It also has so many other features that I wonder why I ever considered the Vizio. When I tried to resolve the connection errors, the initial Customer Service person was nice but ineffective. What was worse was the "Executive Escalation Supervisor" with whom I spoke. He is the reason that I will never own another Vizio product.
customer_reviews.author: George V

customer_reviews.title: Primarily used to stream netflix
customer_reviews.text: I had considered getting a second roku for my master bedroom as we love the one in the living room (streaming netflix is our primary source of viewing). This blu-ray player was only a few dollars more than the roku and obviously adds disc playing ability. Sony's netflix interface isn't quite as streamlined as roku's - nor is the remote as good (sony's is IR while the roku is RF), but it works very well and maintains a very good connection with my router. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: pack howitzer

customer_reviews.title: Good player for the money
customer_reviews.text: Can't say there are a lot of frills or panaz about it but it's compact and sleek and does it's job. the loading speed is a little lackluster but if you're not popping in and out new disks every 15 min then it's fine to wait a minute for it to sort out the spin up and menu display. like the start from left off feature if you have to shut it down during a movie; come back and pics right back up where you started. comp/svid and hdmi options are nice too. all in all a good little unit for the money!
customer_reviews.author: A. Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-S590 3D Blu-ray Disc Player with Wi-Fi (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with this unit I purchased 2. It is easy to set up, just follow the onscreen prompts. It was breeze to setup and use with Amazon Prime, and I have had Amazon Prime for years and never watched any movies. Well now I am and I love it! I would highly recommend this unit. If you have internet available this unit connects so easily I was amazed. I have repaired computers, installed networks, etc. for over 20 years and I was surprised at how easy this was to set up.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Valentine's Day gift. When it had a $50 off coupon.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift. Works perfect. The main need was to be able to watch Netflix on her TV... true we could have hooked up her older laptop, and she has it on her nook, or I could have brought my ps3 over... but that all requires more configuring and time. This worked perfect. Took a little bit to update the software via wifi but no we watch Netflix (Currrently: Breaking Bad) via Yellow/White/Red and it works great. Pretty good quality for her non-HDMI TV. For $48 out the door it was a steal. Thanks again to Amazon for the low price offer!
customer_reviews.author: B. Buller

customer_reviews.title: Still Works good After 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of cool features and use it for Netflix and connecting to our cloud media storage. The only issue we have ever encountered is every once and a while (snot often) we have to unplug and plug back in because it freezes. We have owned for around two years now. Otherwise no complaints and like it a lot. Like the features and capabilities. Searching internet sucks on it though cuz the app for it that it uses clunky and not HD.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Diemert

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up including wifi connection. Quality picture.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and looking at Consumer Reports, I decided on this Blu-Ray Disc Player. I wanted the wi-fi connection for Amazon Prime or Netflix. The set up went without a hitch including picking up the wi-fi signal. I have already watched a movie and a TV show. The loading time was quick. The quality of the Blu-Ray is fine. i must admit I am not as picky or knowledgable as some other reviews. The the price am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: So far so good !!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Sony BDP-S590 about a week ago, was really looking forward to getting it because of all the good reviews it had received, so far not disappointed at all, it does everything it's suppose to do, but like other reviews have mentioned, for web surfing, well the remote is a little clumsy, not a QWERTY style, more like a phone, but if I want to surf the web, well that's why I have a PC, so not that big of a deal for me, overall, good job Sony, and good job Amazon for holding up their end of the deal as well with super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesman

customer_reviews.title: no go for hbo go
customer_reviews.text: DVD plays fine, Netflix works well, remote control on Iphone works but Sony dropped the ball on the interface with internet sites by excluding HBO Go. I understand it also does not include Cinemax Go. Since cable companies charge extra for these services it is important to get them on a smart player. If you're looking for HBO Go you can get it on Samsung devices. I'll keep the DVD box and probably get an expensive converter to hook up my VGA output laptop to the TV. Since I bought the smart Sony for the interface with the internet this is unfortunate. Sony - are you out there? How about an update on your software?
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great player
customer_reviews.text: This Sony player works great, is easy to use and is priced around $100. All the features you would expect from a bluray player: hdmi, optical out, wifi, etc. The player also has all the apps you could ever want for streaming: Netflix, Amazon, Vudu, etc. The only real draw back I could find with this player after extensive use is the slow menu response. It takes a while for some apps to start up, and even then they are kind of sluggish. Even with that drawback I would still recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: If you haven't bought a Blu-Ray player lately, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: Elegant little player that sets itself up. My LG TV was already online with WIFI so Sony got his information through the HDMI cable. It has a great list of online services some of which are free. Most are inexpensive. The 2D to 3D is very effective as it is available in three levels. The load time is normal for a Blu-Ray (slow) but not terrible. Clunky remote but who cares. I am not going to use it for long. I think that it is a very good deal for under 100 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Laidig

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-S590
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased my Samsung TV they included the Samsung Blu-Ray player. While it works OK, it doesn't always play standard DVD's or skips for no reason. I finally got tired of this behavior and bought the Sony. What a world of difference in performance and in internet capabilities. It even has a web browser, but it's nothing to write home about. It does require that you have a PC handy to register the various apps like NETFLIX and to register the player itself.
customer_reviews.author: Fred A Neudecker

customer_reviews.title: So far great for streaming, problem with updating software
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to set up. Updated the software and used it without a hitch. The first software update notification came and after I was notified thru the auto notification in the Sony menu, the wireless stopped accessing the internet. Went thru setup a couple of times without success. Finally connected to my router to the player directly by hard wire and was able to upgrade the software and later connect wireless again. I hope this will help someone else that experiences the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The one I ordered through Amazon arrived with the case cracked. They refunded the cost without any issues. I then purchased this unit locally and set it up without a problem. I have no technical abilities but this unit was easy. It works great, and the menus are very user friendly. The wi-fi set up works good. You can't go wrong with this unit, the price is reasonable for everything that is included in this player. The case is somewhat flimsy so don't set anything on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: CarolB

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but nothing ground breaking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another DVD player that died on me. I think this is my third DVD player. It will upscale on its own in case you did not know. The up-scaling still does not come close to what a Blu-ray looks like. The wi-fi connection is cool, but it is very slow and clunky. The UI is not clean either.... I would have hoped Sony could have done better. So I use this to watch the occasional DVD and use the Roku for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Everything and the kitchen sink....
customer_reviews.text: I chose this unit because it was well rated, but more so... it had numerous connection outputs, it connects to the Internet (wifi or LAN), does NetFlix (my primary objective). When it arrived, it was up and running in minutes. Streamline NetFlix works perfectly. But then, I was going through the options and discovered that it automatically found and will play my videos and pictures from my computer! Also, it's DNLA -- I'm working on getting my Canon Vixia HF50 to connect to it next (connected but I couldn't get the playback - probably user error). The unit is very lightweight, but does take some space. I've only had the unit for a day or two, but it's great already.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Waehner

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for four years and it's still in excellent condition. We use it to access our Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for four years and it's still in excellent condition. We use it to access our Netflix, Hulu, Amazon and YouTube accounts too. We cut off cable TV and haven't missed it, except for football. Turned out to be a feature too b/c now we get out more to see games with friends.
customer_reviews.author: txgemini

customer_reviews.title: Nice price
customer_reviews.text: The Sony set up was easy (already had an account due to our PS3) and work well. The USB port made setup much easier since I was able to plug in a keyboard to configure the Wi-Fi connection and other sections requiring data entry. I've left the keyboard connected since it makes Amazon Prime searching easier. Connection and configuration of Prime was simple. I personally haven't tried a Blu-ray disk but the kids haven't complained about watching movies on it. It's a good media solution for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Performance...good app choices
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a well-reviewed wifi-enabled blu-ray player that had Pandora, Netflix, AND Amazon apps. This was the strongest contender, and it's been working great. Easy to install (hey, it's HDMI, what's not easy) and no issues setting up on my wifi network. Picture quality is great. The remote design is a weakness (most players' remotes are) and it would have been vastly improved with backlighting, but, for the price, I'm not going to ding the rating on that basis.
customer_reviews.author: MCXB

customer_reviews.title: Superb - bulletproof and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought a Samsung BD C5900 but it quit playing blu ray disks after 9 months - after some research it was a common problem. Rather than repair I opted to change. I knew I should have bought Sony! Very pleased. Should have stuck with Sony all along. Their products are always reliable. The interface, whilst not looking as nice as Samsung's is actually pretty easy to navigate around. Even my wife can use it to stream movies from the computer to the blu ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Works great like all the features
customer_reviews.text: I recieved the player in good shape was boxed nice easy to open. I like all the streaming netflix and amazon works great, blue ray player works good, I like the fact that the unit checks for updates since sony seems to change the blue ray format often. Easy to use remote just left right up and down, everything is large and easy to pick the options you want. Since I did not have a blue ray player to compare this one to, I do not know if the loading of the disk is fast or slow but seems ok to me.
customer_reviews.author: William Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for mother
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says it was a present for my mother and although she has no idea how to use most of the features she already has a very nice LED 3D tv so this was a must to complement her set up. I hooked it all up for her was very simple if you just use the HDMI cable(sold separately). It is thin, black and sony. I was hesistant about buying a sony product it has worked fine so far right out of the box even connecting to my wireless router was super easy and boot up is fast!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M

customer_reviews.title: WiFi failed after just a few months of operation.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically for the "smart" player capabilities via the internet on WiFi. I could not run a cable, so WiFi was the only solution. It FAILED after just a few months of operation. The DVD still worked, but the WiFi would not connect. I tried everything (3 times). After resetting everything from scratch and re-entering all password info for Netflix, etc. it would work for about an hour then go out again. I purchased an LG and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product, sub-par packaging...
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying I have been an Amazon customer since my undergrad days...I have been very satisfied w/ most everything I've purchased. Upon receiving the Sony BDP-S590, however, I was concerned that a relatively delicate electronic component such as a blu-ray player would be packed in a box w/ NO bubble wrap?! The external box was also torn completely open at the corner. I have received books so encased in bubble wrap they literally had to be peeled open...Seems odd to pack ANY electronic devices w/ NONE?! Rant aside, device works well so far...Great features for price, also plays media from USB drive. No internet connection yet, will update as service is available.
customer_reviews.author: KJXerciser

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: Has played everything I've thrown at it so far -- blu-rays and DVDs alike. The quality of picture is outstanding. One blu-ray (Disney WOW) warned that it might take a while to process and pull up the next image, but it came up pretty quickly. I've really enjoyed using my phone as a remote, since in a dark room it's practically impossible to see the remote that came with it. Love this downloadable (and free) Android app. I have found NO problems with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not Web surfer
customer_reviews.text: Plays DVDs well. Displays digital Photos great. Has a user friendly interface. My only thing I wish was better is the internet interface Internet is accessed by using the remote and this is a clumsy interface. Make a mistake and you have to start over. Once you get to a web page you can view the page but you can not use a curser arrow to navigate. But it is a very good DVD and photo slide show viewer but not a good way to surf the World Wide Web
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Reconditioned, but it does not show!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Blu-ray player with fabulous features (especially Wi-Fi, which streams wonderfully on my home network). Sold on Amazon by "Good As New Electronics", this was my first try at factory reconditioned electronics, and I must say that, other than the sticker on the side of the player indicating such, I could not tell that the unit was not brand new. And being reconditioned made the price even nicer!
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Interface for internet apps is.....meh
customer_reviews.text: The remote itself feels cheap and I'm afraid it's definitely going to be the first thing to go. On three occasions in the last month, it has frozen up and I've had to unplug it in order to get anything working. If your set-up is anything like mine, unplugging it isn't the easiest task. That power strip is buried back in the corner behind so many things. But this was inexpensive and playback has been great. I can't say I regret the purchase because it wasn't a huge expense.
customer_reviews.author: K Brooks

customer_reviews.title: So far its excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to ditch my Roku and use this for streaming Netflix. It works well so far. There is a boot up and a short connecting to the net thing that goes on sometimes, but its not a big deal, just press ok at the end. It powers off on its own after a certain time, which is very nice. It can tell the TV to turn on when it turns on which is also nice. I think only certain TVs are capable of this. DVDs and BLU RAYS I have had no issue and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Product works
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK product. The price was right, it works. Occassionally it will get confused and stop responding to inputs and you have to unplug it. In 5 months that has happened about 4 times-less now than in the beginning. Not sure why. Start up is also very slow. It takes a while for the unit to process the disc which is annoying. But it works well and is clear. There is a lot of other multimedia stuff that perhaps some people use but I don't. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jjdynomite

customer_reviews.title: First One DOA
customer_reviews.text: The first player received would not open. I sent it back, received a credit and ordered another one. The second one works perfectly (so far) and I have no complaints other than having to go through the effort/hassle of doing a return. I guess it can happen to any product and the real proof of quality is in customer service. The rating of 5 stars comes from the excellent customer service of Amazon not because I like the player that well......the player itself is worthy of 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marker

customer_reviews.title: Remote doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have other ways to watch DVD's and bought this specifically to watch Blue-ray movies and special features. I can sometimes manage to watch a movie but the remote freezes and I cannot move thru the menu choices to pick, audio options, special features, scenes, etc. I press the arrows and nothing happens. I contacted Sony and they told me to download any upgrades and I may have to do this 3 or 4 times before this problem would be fixed. Accordingly, I downloaded the upgrades 4 times. Didn't fix anything. It works fine for watching DVDs but I don't need it for that. I am sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tishma

customer_reviews.title: Good WiFi Blu-Ray for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good wifi machine, especially for the price. Works smoothly and without a hitch on several streaming services. My only complaint is when I plug in my iPod to the USB jack conveniently located on the front of the unit (it even has a slick "garage door" cover) this blu-ray does not read the artist, album or songs. All you get is a bunch of "files" with meaningless file numbers and you have to click on each one to know what music it contains, which is crazy when you have a decent size collection. Otherwise this blu-ray works great, with the caveat that I have not tried the 3D.
customer_reviews.author: The Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray/media player
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a Blu-ray player that has media streaming support this is a great device for the price. Wile it still will not play MKV files it will stream most AVI and MP4 files with out any issue due to HomeShare. Has the same menu system as the PS3 if you have ever used one. I had bought both this model and the Sony BDP-S390. About the same device but this model support 3D. If you do not need 3D the BDP-S390 is all you need. Can't ask for more for the price. Very Happy
customer_reviews.author: Chris Frey

customer_reviews.title: Love at first play
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazingly easy installation - connect the HDMI cord, plug it in, and you're good to go. The visual interface for searching for online resources (YouTube, Pandorra, Netflix, etc.) is extremly user-friendly - and there's even a button for Netflix on the remote. The video quality seems to be as good as any other Blue Ray player I have seen, so what sets this player out is its ease of use (everything from the box to selecting online content) and its great price. I strongly recommend this unit!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old vizio Blu-ray player. This thing works great seems to load up pretty fast. The menu is similar to my PS3 so it was easy to figure everything out. It connected to the WiFi really easily. I saw some people were complaining about making a sony entertainment account, but it only took a few minutes and as soon as i finished all the apps loaded up, i honestly didnt even know there were that many apps for watching movies and tv shows, not to mention the music apps to. Also it came with a few month trial of hulu and a few other things.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Too bad we had return it!
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described, looked great and at first worked well. Within about a week( if even) it began to open and close whenever it felt the need to do so. It also made a terrible noise (randomly). We liked the interface, but it just didn't work the correct way. The product arrived fine and properly packed, there did not seem to be any type of damage, can not be sure if it was banged around in transit and perhaps that caused issues or if it was just simply a bad apple.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Live up to the name
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this, I tried panasonic and samsung (forgot the series), which both were terrible at receiving the Internet connection. Everytime I wanted to connect to Amazon video/Netflix, they always failed and always asked me to re-enter my Internet password. It's so annoying. At first, I thought I had bad connection. But then I didn't have problems w/ my iPhone using the wi-fi. Returned those and did some research on Amazon and decided to try this based on the reviews. It's easy to connect and set up. Easy to navigate. Most important, doesn't have any problem at all w/ the Internet connection. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: shop4fun

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is only the second BR player I've owned and is a major upgrade from the cheap-o box I got from Blockbuster video when they were offering a low-cost BR player with new memberships. I'm sure the higher-priced (and now newer models) have more features and have a faster operating system but this little gem works really well, has great wireless connectivity and more content apps that I'll ever use. It's never frozen, or not played a BR disc properly - it just works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still ticking!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and with each new system update, there are lots of new features. Sometimes the wifi has to be reset, which is annoying, but not a deal breaker, as it takes about 2 minutes to do. We don't have a 3d tv, so I couldn't tell you how the 3d looks. Everything else is great though!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Great price from Amazon compared to the local brick and mortar store I visited. It was easy to set up and the interface between Amazon Video is great. I can watch Amazon Prime Video content with no problems...the Ethernet cable connection to the Verizon FiOS router enables blazing fast speeds for standard and HD video from Amazon. The 2-year old is watching Dora the Explorer right now and the streaming video quality is perfect. And OBTW it plays DVDs without any glitches. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: speedypete2112

customer_reviews.title: great player
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Blu-ray player. It's easy to set up, inexpensive, and works excellently. The only thing I don't like is how you have to register almost everything through Sony first, which is kind of irritating. I also don't like that I can't play normal Hulu or most internet videos on it, due to the Flash hardware, which I assume will be updated at some point, which should fix that. Lightweight, easy to use, not a complicated remote. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. ZHI

customer_reviews.title: Still early
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this player to replace one that was only a couple of years old. Compared to my older player, this one loads much more quickly. I was having some difficulty playing some DVD's with the old player. I have had none with this one. I am also enjoying the wireless options to access content. I am quite satisfied with this player, but have not had it long enough to give it 5 stars. If it continues to perform as it has thus far, I would change to the highest rating.
customer_reviews.author: North Texas Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Like this one a lot
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Wi-Fi feature of this player. I love being able to watch netflix and hulu on here. I don't rent as many moveis as I used to , but you can rent from so many different places on here. The remote makes it kind of difficult to enter title searches, but once you get used to it, it isn't so bad. IT freezes up from time to time when navigating between programs, but usually a power down and back on will correct it quickly. Has a great picture, but I couldn't tell you the specifics.
customer_reviews.author: clegend

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful, slim height-wise, and it works very well!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine has one of these, and he strongly recommended it to me, along with the Magnavox DVD Recorder/VCR Combo unit, and, with both of them plugged into a Denon AV Surround Receiver, it's the perfect "heart" for an entertainment system. For what it's worth, this Blu-ray Disc Player can handle both mp3 and wav recording formats! Hey, but it's Sony! How can you get any better?!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Halsey

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Latest addition to my home theater. Got it 2 hrs ago, replaced the xbox, powered it up, got linked to my router which was just 40 ft away (1bar) not sure if thats a problem yet,, updated the software, put in DarkKnight and hit play. 20' HDMI cable to an Optima HD33 throwing 15ft to an EZ frame 100" screen. Looks Great. Audio pumped nicely through my old Kenwood reciever and 90s floor speakers that I'm using till I can upgrade. So far seems well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in CT

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it, WiFi isn't super strong
customer_reviews.text: Overall we are pleased. It took several tries to get the update to work: I had to actually connect it to my router as it didn't work over the WiFi. We stream Amazon movies, and generally it works pretty well. Sometimes the WiFi signal strength meter shows it gets weaker for some reason, but we haven't had problems with buffering except once or twice. I don't love the interface especially, but it's not enough to keep me from recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: What Happened to the Price?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item back in March 2013 and I've been happy with everything about it. It works great, getting the wireless going was not difficult, and the functional controls are good. I was thinking about buying another one for a different room and noted that the price was now almost $250. The one I bought in March, from Amazon, was about $99. Maybe it was mis-priced back then??? Now I'm going to order the Sony BDP-S3100 for $88
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: I'ts All In There
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a machine for a decent price. It was easy to connect to my Yamaha Soundbar receiver and to my wifi. Having four remotes was an inconvenience so I picked up a Logitech Harmony remote which handles all 4 devices (TV, Cable, Blu-Ray and Sound bar. The Sony BD contains connections to a variety of entertainment options such as Netflix, Pandora, Hulu, Crackle and more. I have not used all of the available features yet but to this point but I have used enough to qualify this unit as a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stuck

customer_reviews.title: Great DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: This was compared to a Panasonic as being the two best, but the panasonic was rated higher for an easier menu. If you own a playstation, the menu of this DVD player is almost exactly the same. So intuitive, so I can't imagine that the Panasonic really could have been better. Only thing I wish this had was a sleep timer so it wouldn't cycle all night if I fall asleep watching a movie...but otherwise I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BJL99

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: QUIT WORKING AFTER UNDER TWO YEARS - although it was good for a while, it was permanently and totally killed by a "software update" that we couldn't stop or refuse in late fall 2014. Nothing has made it fully functional since then, and it's been recycled. Only had this a week but setup with the wifi and Amazon Prime was remarkably easy, and the streaming video option works very well. It works fine as a DVD player too, nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Yet another customer

customer_reviews.title: WiFi "Network error" occurs often, despite network status "OK"
customer_reviews.text: I frequently watch Netflix and Amazon Streaming Video. I didn't have any trouble setting up the Sony and was able to watch Netflix/Amazon without any trouble...for a few weeks. After that, I started getting a Network Error when I tried to connect. It asks if I want to check the connection and the connection says "OK" for internet access and network connection, yet I cannot connect. I've tried resetting the network settings. It seems to happen about 1 out of 3 times I try to use it. So frustrating and I already passed my Roku player on.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

product_meta.title: Sony BDP-S590 3D Blu-ray Disc Player with Wi-Fi (Black) (2012 Model)
product_meta.description:
3D Blu-ray Disc Full HD 1080p playback. Built-in Wi-Fi. Sony Entertainment Network: Netflix, YouTube, Pandora, Hulu Plus& more. Media Remote app for iPhone/iPad & Android phones. Share music throughout home with Home Share.Input/Output Connectors: Analog-1x Composite Video,1x 2-Channel Audio (RCA),Digital-1x HDMI,1x Digital Optical Audio,1x Digital Coaxial Audio,Other-1x Ethernet,2x USB.What's in the box: Sony BDP-S590 Blu-ray Disc Player, Remote Control (RMT-B119A), 2 x AA Batteries, A/V Cable, Warranty Card, Owner's Manual and1-Year Parts & Labor Warranty.A/V Playback Formats: Video: BD-R, BD-RE, BD-ROM, DVD, DVD+R, DVD+R DL, DVD+RW, DVD-R, DVD-R DL, DVD-RW, Audio: CD, CD-R, CD-RW, SACD, File Formats Supported: null, AVCHD, GIF, JPEG, MP3, MPEG-4, MPEG1, MPEG2, PNG, null.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER







Enjoy Full HD 1080p Blu-ray Disc playback1 and your favorites from Netflix, 
Youtube, Pandora, Hulu Plus and more2 with the Sony BDP-S590 
Blu-ray Disc Player. Wirelessly stream movies, TV shows, music 
and more, even in 3D1 for an ultimate movie watching experience. 

Wonderfully Wi-Fi. Streaming Entertainment. Deeper Clarity. Integrated Wi-Fi on your Blu-ray eliminates extra cables and connects effortlessly to your home network so you can get online faster and start streaming your favorite entertainment right away. Built-in Wi-Fi and the incredible Sony Entertainment Network allow you to instantly stream an astonishing array of entertainment options, from movies and videos to TV shows and music from your favorite content providers. Pair your Blu-ray player with a compatible 3D HDTV to enjoy the next level of entertainment. Full 1080p HD jumps to life like never before in stunning 3D so real that you’ll feel like you’re in the middle of the action. 


Technology

Now Streaming With the convenience of built-in Wi-Fi, it’s easier than ever to instantly stream an astonishing array of online movies, videos, TV shows, and music from Netflix, YouTube, HuluPlus, Pandora and more.2 Watch exactly what you want, when you want. Wi-Fi Connectivity Connect to all the internet has to offer minus annoyance of extra cables. Integrated Wi-Fi makes it a cinch to tap into your home’s existing wireless network, meaning you'll be streaming all the things you love in no time. Stunning 3D in Full 1080p HD Ready to enter the next dimension of entertainment? Pair your Blu-ray player with a 3D HDTV and you'll find yourself transported to exotic locales alongside your favorite actors – all in beautifully rich Full 1080p HD. Control with Your Mobile Device Turn your iPhone, iPad or compatible Android phone into a versatile remote by downloading the free Media Remote app. Get all the basic remote functions plus access to a full Qwerty keyboard that makes searching the internet for movie info a snap. Rock the House Do more than play your favorite movies. Add Sony HomeShare wireless network speakers (sold separately) to stream music from a CD, your personal music library or even the internet to virtually any area of your home. Move from room to room without skipping a beat – it's perfect for your 
next party. Socialize While Watching Best fight scene ever? Cutest love story of all time? Add to the excitement by sharing it with others – post comments on what you’re watching, while you're watching it via Facebook and Twitter with a 
Socialize message. 
Product description and full feature list The BDP-S590 Blu-ray Disc Player with 3D and Wi-Fi is equipped with the latest technology to bring you 
incredible entertainment quality. Explore the full range of features and options below. 
Built-in Wi-Fi
With built-in Wi-Fi, you can easily connect to the Internet through your home's wireless broadband network.

Sony Entertainment Network
With the Sony Entertainment Network, you can instantly stream a wide variety of online movies, videos, TV shows, and music from Netflix, YouTube, Pandora, Hulu Plus and more.2 

Make movies more stunning
Enjoy 3D Blu-ray Disc movies in Full HD 1080p and upscale the visual quality of DVDs to near HD quality. In addtion, the 2D to 3D conversion feature allows your DVDs or Blu-ray Disc movies to be automatically converted into 3D for playback on your 3D TV.1 

Sony Media Remote App
With the free Sony Media RemoteTM app enjoy a full Qwerty keyboard and movie information search capabilities on your iPhone, iPad, iPod touch, Android phone or Sony Tablet.3 



Multi-room music with 
Party Streaming Mode
With the Sony BDP-S590, you can wirelessly stream music throughout the home to Sony Wireless Network speakers.4

Quick Start/Quick Load
The BDP-S590 allows you to enjoy your movies within seconds with the Quick Start/Quick Load feature. 

Life, easily shared
Bring your favorite videos, photos and music to your TV with dual USB inputs.6

Socialize
The Socialize feature allows you to "Socialize" what you watch over Facebook and Twitter while you watch TV. 




Easy Access
Using DLNA you can wirelessly access music, videos and photos from your PC or other compatible Android device and stream them to your Blu-ray Disc Player.6

Throw your music and photos 
Photos and music from your Sony Tablet or other compatible Android device can be "thrown" directly to the BDPS-590 for enjoyment on your TV.7 

Sound you can feel
Experience the highest sound quality with Dolby TrueHD and dts-HD codecs which reproduce high-definition sound with 7.1 channels of discrete audio for uncompromised quality.8 

Learn more about your movies
Get detailed movie information and search across Internet apps, including YouTube and Video Unlimited for related entertainment with Gracenote. 






Compare Sony models BDP-S185
BDP-S390
BDP-S590
BDP-S790
SMPN-200

PRO – Sony Entertainment Network1 Socialize Media Remote App6 – 
DLNA7 – Sony Wi-Fi Network Speaker Compatible8 – 
"Throw" Your Music and Photos9 – – Gracenote with Cross Search10 – 
– Skype on Your TV11 – – – – 

1. Requires 3D content, 1080p 3D HDTV, 3D glasses, 3D emitter, and HDMI cable (at least 10.2 Gbps).

2. Broadband speed of at least 2.5 Mbps recommended (10 Mbps for HD). Content subject to change and may require fees. Wireless connectivity requires an 802.11 home network (802.11n recommended).

3. Applications must be downloaded from the iTunes or Android application store. Check Android market from your device for compatibility. Requires devices connected to the same wireless home network.

4. Requires Sony HomeShare compatible products and a home network. HomeShare NetWork speakers are sold separately.

5. Requires a home network with content stored on a DLNA compliant PC or server, and HomeShare network speaker, dock, or Blu-ray Disc player or home theater system. See dlna.org for compatibility.

6. Not all USB devices are supported. Please check Owner's Manual for compatibility.

7. Requires devices connected to the same wireless home network.

8. Requires HDMI cable and LPCM capable receiver.
